availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Y. Gardner (Warren County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, farmer and Justice of the Peace. Virginia native. Married to Anna J. Edwards Gardner in Edmonson County, Kentucky, on January 2, 1834. Father of Ivy Gardner, James E. Gardner, Sarah J. Gardner, Henry T. Gardner, Mary E. Gardner, Phoebe A. Gardner, John W. Gardner, Benjamin F. Gardner, and Jane Gardner. Farmer in Edmonson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Edmonson County in 1850. Farmer in Warren County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Warren County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 11A-B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 485.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, District 1, p. 740.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 426 B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Elks Springs, p. 145 B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Edmonson County Marriages, Film #000367220.
KYR-0001-031-0057.
